intro: Leucanthemum vulgare proles pallens, commonly known as the pale coneflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow-orange central cone, blooming from late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, gray-green leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to native gardens.
